comments.author: Simone (junglefrog)
comments.content: Wow! That just looks very impressive!! I've always wondered how that was done.. Gorgeous photo!

comments.author: diva
comments.content: This is wonderful and so clever! What a lovely way to up the mood at the dinner table as well. Thanks for sharing. I might whip this out when I host a dinner some time. Be sure to impress everyone :) Gorgeous photo too.

comments.author: The Cooking Ninja
comments.content:
Oh yes, the bakeries in Singapore do put a small dry ice to keep the cake cold and I did hurt myself picking those up from the box.

Love your pic. :)

comments.author: Online Consultation
comments.content: Dry ice? Is this safe to smell? But interesting concept of spreading fumes.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Yep, you gotta be careful! Hopefully nothing to serious though?

comments.author: Diana @ frontyardfoodie
comments.content: I'm impressed! That looks so incredibly beautiful. An idea I hadn't thought about but it makes perfect, elegant sense.
